comments:
I20060427-1200-win32

1. Create an RCP product (I used the exampel created in the cheatsheet "Create an RCP Application using PDE")
2. Open the rcpapp.product file in an editor.
3. Window->Show View->Error Log
4. Click on the hyperlink "Eclipse Product export wizard"

The export wizard will open

5. Start typing into teh configuration field.

A null pointer exception is reported to the log for every character typed in.
can you please copy and paste the NPE?

I was wrong, it was an illegal argument exception not an NPE. I just changed
the bug title to reflect that. Here's the log.

apparently, IWorkspaceRoot.getFile(new Path(path)); throws an IllegalArgumentException if it does not like the path.

John, how new are these assertions?

Roughly, these assertions have existed since the Paleozoic era - as far back as CVS history goes ;)  

The javadoc says "The path of the resulting resource must have at least two segments."  We can't create an IFile for a path with one segment, because we wouldn't be able to answer IFile.getProject()...
Fixed by checking the path is A-OK before sending it to Jurassic John-land.

traces.message: Path must include project and resource name: /aaaaaa
